events.name: Manchester United at West Ham United

headlines.description: Jose Mourinho dropped Alexis Sanchez from his squad for the game, but Paul Pogba started after their training ground row.
headlines.shortLinkText: United's woe continues with defeat at West Ham

headlines.description: A late own-goal from Watford's Craig Cathcart and a Mesut Ozil strike two minutes later gave Arsenal a 2-0 win at the Emirates Stadium.
headlines.shortLinkText: Late goals give Arsenal flattering 2-0 win

headlines.description: Gylfi Sigurdsson went from villain into hero as he struck twice to inspire Everton to their customary home win, 3-0, against Fulham.
headlines.shortLinkText: Two-goal Sigurdsson helps Everton to win

headlines.description: Harry Kane scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur moved into fourth place in the Premier League with a 2-0 win at bottom club Huddersfield Town.
headlines.shortLinkText: Kane double at Huddersfield sends Spurs fourth

events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Manchester City

headlines.description: Raheem Sterling opened the scoring with a simple tap-in for his fourth goal of the season after excellent work from Leroy Sane on the left.
headlines.shortLinkText: Blues cruise as Aguero and Sterling strike

headlines.description: Newcastle have now lost their opening four home games of the season for the first time and stayed 18th on two points from seven matches.
headlines.shortLinkText: Newcastle in dire straits after 2-0 defeat

headlines.description: The two sides cancelled each other out for much of the game, and it took some individual brilliance from Wolves' Adama Traore to break the deadlock.
headlines.shortLinkText: Sub Cavaleiro leads Wolves surge as Southampton suffer again

headlines.description: The result means both Chelsea and Liverpool remain unbeaten while Manchester City moved to the top of the table.
headlines.shortLinkText: Sturridge stunner saves Liverpool's unbeaten start
